citations.narrative:
The record of animals on hand does not accurately represent the current inventory of animals at the facility and is missing
both acquisition and disposition information. According to the paperwork, there should be 27 budgerigars (parakeets) but
a total of 33 budgerigars were present at the facility. The paperwork also indicates there should be 7 domestic chickens,
while only 6 chickens were present at the facility. Finally, a total of 13 rabbits are written on the inventory while only 12
rabbits are present at the facility. Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility, are necessary
to accurately track and identify animals being used in regulated activities, as well as aid in the detection of movement of
animals. Correct by 11 June 2025 by making, keeping, and maintaining records or forms which fully and correctly disclose
all of the information required in this section of the AWA concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned,
held, leased, or otherwise in your possession or under your control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise
disposed of.

The primary enclosure housing 11 adult rabbits has a metal livestock gate with its bottom metal bar severely rusted and
disintegrating, leaving a sharp section approximately 3-4" long of flaking metal within reach of the rabbits. Metal that is
rusted and flaking apart leaves sharp edges that can injure the rabbits. Correct by ensuring the primary enclosure is
structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits from injury, to contain them, and to keep predators
out. Corrected during the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility manager.
